title: Tab menu freezes; I can't click between tabs
content:
Tabs in the tab bar randomly, suddenly can't be interacted with by mouse/trackpad pointer, sometimes even just the one and only tab in a window won't close when clicking on the "X." The keyboard commands to cycle between tabs and close tabs still work, but this is frustrating nevertheless. I've tried disabling all the add-ons I added in the month or two before the problem started. I refreshed Firefox, but once I added my add-ons back in, the problem persisted.

What else can I try to fix this? Any input would be appreciated.
creator: stvvbkk

title: Website states access denied need authorization How to fix this problem
content: Hello I am trying to access a store website and it states access denied need authorization. This is my personal computer. How do I authorize this website?
creator: DJCRIC

title: Constantly have to force quit, cannot clear history, etc
content: Hello,unfortunately I am not the most computer savvy person (sorry). I have been experiencing a few problems with Firefox over the last month or so. I currently use a Mac desktop and a Macbook and they sync together. I keep Firefox up to date as updates become available. My Macbook is fine but on my desktop I frequently have to Force Quit the application. In addition, I cannot clear my browsing history, cannot add a new bookmark nor able to delete a bookmark. I thought at first that maybe a bookmark I added may have caused a problem (?) on my desktop but the problem did not transfer over to my laptop upon syncing. I was thinking of uninstalling Firefox and reinstalling it but I wanted to get an expert opinion. Is there a fix for this problem, have I done something wrong? As well, in your opinion are ad blocking applications such as 'ADBLOCK' or 'U BLOCK ORIGIN' compatible with Firefox / Apple Mac? Thank you in advance for any assistance you can give me, and thank you for continually delivering a superior browser!
creator: highend

title: Better fix for question mark boxes in Firefox ?
content:
This fixed my problem with question mark boxes (which I have seen, then not seen, then seen again over versions of FF on a Mac): https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1178462

But the answer is 3 years old and nearly 30 FF versions ago, and furthermore requires lowering security. Is there a newer, better solution for fixing the problem with seeing question mark boxes instead of glyphs for certain fonts? (And one that doesn't require me to constantly toggle "Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above" in Preferences, which only works sometimes anyway.)

title: Firefox 83.0.1 y 84 no imprime en PDF (Ha ocurrido un error al imprimir)
content:
Desde la versión 83 en adelante (82.x y anteriores funcionaba correctamente) hasta la nueva versión 84, Firefox, no imprime en formato PDF, dando el siguiente error: Ha ocurrido un error al imprimir en la vista preliminar y creando un archivo PDF guardado con contenido en 0 bytes o corrupto.

He probado la edición del archivo prefs, borrando todas las lineas print del mismo y error procede. He restablecido el navegador por defecto y todo sigue igual.

He probado Edge Chronium y con este este funciona bien, al igual que con Opera.

He seguido todos los consejos del foro y de la ayuda sin éxito alguno, así que solo me queda pedir ayuda a la comunidad y de paso comunicarlo.

title: FF tabs keep crashing randomly
content:
Tabs of FF keep crashing at random. This occurs on websites that I regularly visit and that usually do not crash. Restarting FF and reopening the very same website works without crashing. Usually the crashes occur only after a few tabs are open, but there is no clear pattern as to why, when, or how they occur. No websites are particularly prone, it does not occur in any pattern time-wise, and also does not seem to be linked to the number of open tabs.

This has been happening for a while now, i.e., even across different FF versions.

I am using up-to-date FF on the most recent version on Win10 on an otherwise perfectly fine working computer (Intel Hades Canyon NUC) with plenty of resources.

title: Unable to Log-in to Outlook Using Firfox...
content:
I am unable to log-in to Outlook through my Firefox Browser, I can however, log in using MS Edge and IE browsers. I have tried:

  • Refreshing Firefox
  • Deleting Cookies, Cashe, and History
  • Disabling the "Block Pop-Ups" option
  • Clearing any saved data, i.e. log-ins, passwords, etc.
  • Uninstalling FF, Shutting down, rebooting, reinstalling, downloading FF, and logging in to Outlook without first logging in to my FF account, and after logging in to my FF account
  • Making FF my default mail app in my default programs.

Nothing works!!! Please Help. -David

title: Screen turns blue with Firefox
content:
Hi

Since about two or three weeks I have got a strange behavior from Firefox. The first time it happens was while loading a html5 game called "Holyday City Reloaded" on Armorgames. The whole screen turns to a azur-blue. No items, menu or anything on it, just plain blue over the whole screen. It lasts for some seconds then my screen was ok again. Since then every time I opend this game it happens again. Once this "blue screen" (no crash) does not disapeard, so I had to reboot.

Well we could say its something about this game... but no, because today I opend Firefox and the screen wents blue again without opening any task.

It only happens with firefox, other browsers don't do that. I have allready tried diffrent graphiccard drivers, and turnd off the addons. Well, it didn't helped.

Any suggestions?

title: Migration problem
content: One year ago I switched from Thunderbird to Outlook (I was forced to do it by the IT-department at my work office). When I migrated I took a backup of all my e-mails from 2009 to 2019 by putting them in a map in Explorer - they are saved as .elm-files. Today I would like to import my elm-files to Outlook, which is easy (copy and paste). The problem is that Outlook doesn´t know how to sort my elm-files according to their original date. The original date is written in each of my elm-files, but Outlook dates them according to the day when I imported them to Outlook, which means that I can´t see my Thunderbird mails in Outlook in chronological order. Anybody who knows a good solution to this? I have Windows 10.

title: since Raspberry Pi OS is using PulseAudio, Firefox 78.5.0esr does not play audio for some videos anymore.
content:
hi, i am using Firefox 78.5.0esr (32-bit) on my Raspberry Pi 4 (with 4GB). since the December 2020 update, Raspberry Pi OS is using PulseAudio as top overlay for ALSA, and Firefox 78.5.0esr does not play audio for some videos anymore.

the maintainers of Raspberry Pi OS told me that it is not an issue of them, it must be an issue of Firefox. they told, it is maybe an issue related to bug #1422073: no audio unless pulseaudio is already running but none of the suggestions there helped me.

here a link to a video that does not play audio in firefox, but play audio in chromium browser. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Wrc4fHSCpw

i, tried to clean cache, reset preferences, removed add-ons, made a new clean installation on a new clean system, but nothing helped. all the time the same behavior - some videos does not play with audio in firefox, others do.

Raspberry Pi OS is an 32-bit opperating system for Raspberry Pi that has an ARM cpu, for those who don't know, what i am talking from. https://www.raspberrypi.org https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=28&t=293746
